Air pollution would significantly decrease as there would be fewer vehicles emitting harmful gases into the atmosphere.
Traffic congestion would be greatly reduced as bicycles take up less space on the road, allowing for smoother and faster traffic flow.
Health benefits would increase as people would be more active and exercise regularly while commuting to work or school.
Cost savings would be realized as bicycles are cheaper to maintain and operate than cars, saving individuals and society as a whole money on fuel, maintenance, and insurance.
A new industry would emerge, focusing on the design, manufacturing, and maintenance of high-quality bicycles, creating new job opportunities and stimulating economic growth.
